SEARCH
Package org.Group2

Class ContinuousIntegrationServer

java.lang.Object
org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle
org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
org.Group2.ContinuousIntegrationServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle
public class ContinuousIntegrationServer extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
A small lightweight handler for a server which implements core CI server functionality including webhook communication over http, cloning, building and testing of a github repository and then returning responses to the original Github commit.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle

  • Method Details

    • handle

      public void handle(String target, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request baseRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException, javax.servlet.ServletException
      Main handle function. Is called for every incoming http request. The function makes sure that the request is from github webhooks and then continues calling every step of the CI routine.
      Throws:
      IOException
      javax.servlet.ServletException

    • sendBuilds

      public void sendBuilds(String target, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException, javax.servlet.ServletException
      Function for creating a basic HTML string of queried build log-files and sending the builds as http response through HttpServletResponse
      Parameters:
      target - a string specifying the path target
      response - a HttpServletResponse to send HTML string to
      Throws:
      IOException
      javax.servlet.ServletException

    • getPushedBranch

      public String getPushedBranch(org.json.JSONObject jsonRequest)
      Take a request from a git webhook and return a string with the branch the action took place on.
      Parameters:
      jsonRequest - A request from a github webhook parsed as a JSONObject.
      Returns:
      A string with the name of the branch.

    • getRepoURL

      public String getRepoURL(org.json.JSONObject jsonRequest)
      Takes a JSON object from a github webhook request and returns the ssh url to the repository.
      Parameters:
      jsonRequest - A request parsed as a JSONObject containing an object with a repository which has an ssh_url key.
      Returns:
      A string containing the ssh-url to the repository

    • cloneRepo

      public static void cloneRepo(String repoURL) throws Exception
      Clones a github repository to the folder ./clonedRepo that can later be built and tested.
      Parameters:
      repoURL - the destination of the repository to be cloned
      Throws:
      Exception - if cloning failed

    • runCommand

      public int runCommand(String command, String path, File logFile)

      Parameters:

      path - a string specifying the directory
      logFile - a File to write stdout to, null if no log should be written
      Returns:
      exit value/code of the process

      public boolean compileMvnProject(String path)

      Parameters:
      path - a string specifying the directory
      Returns:
      a boolean value which is true if the compile was successful, and false otherwise

    • testMvnProject

      public boolean testMvnProject(String path, File logFile)
      Runs a Maven project test-suite located in a specified directory. If the project is not yet compiled, the function will also compile.
      Parameters:
      path - a string specifying the directory
      logFile - a File to write build-logs to, null if no log should be written
      Returns:
      a boolean value which is true if the tests were successful, and false otherwise

      public File createBuildLogFile(org.json.JSONObject logInfo)

      Parameters:
      logInfo - a JSONObject acquired from a http request
      Returns:
      the created File

    • sendResponse

      public void sendResponse(boolean build, boolean tests, org.json.JSONObject jObject)
      Sends a post-request to the github api setting the check-status of the commit.
      Parameters:
      build - status of the build (success/failure)
      tests - status of the tests (success/failure)
      jObject - the json-data acquired from the request
